Senator Marco Rubio (R-FL) introduced the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracry Right (S.417) in 2017, proposing that individuals who suppress basic freedoms be sanctioned (https://www.congress.gov/bill/115th-congress/senate-bill/417). This is a well-intentioned bill which unfortunately died in the Senate without due attention. I sincerely ask that you take actions to support the re-introduction of this bill in the Senate in the 116th Congress, plus any punitive actions that the Congressional Executive Commission on China and your other congressional colleagues may take in regard to the situation in Hong Kong. Among other things, I fully support a comprehensive review of the 1992 US-Hong Kong Policy Act, which has so far granted Hong Kong special status distinct from China. There appear to be no useful actions aside from sanctions against China to change its malign behavior. At the same time, I ask that all sanctions include clauses that protect the interests of the hundreds of thousands of Hongkongers currently in the US
